divs: sighting detailsi was driving to work traveling south on the four lane and observed a "star\planet like" object to the south approximately 30 degrees above the horizon (i had to lean forward a little to observe the object while driving)> at first it appeared to be very far away as a star or planet would be. i say "as a planet would be" because it was as bright as venus or jupiter would appear if it was at night - brighter than a star. at first i thought it might be a planet, but i do not remember seeing any planet that brightly in that position this time of year nor at this time of day. at one point i said to myself, "i guess it could be a star." then i looked around to see if i could see any other stars in the sky and i could not - it was too light out by that time in the morning - it was a bright and clear october morning and the sun had not risen above the horizon yet, but there was enough sunlight that no stars could be seen by this time. i was now quite curious as to what the object might be and considered that it might be the landing lights on a large passenger jet coming in for a landing at the airport which is also south by several miles from my observation point. however after observing the object (which appeared to be stationary) for a couple of minutes (the object also appeared at first appeared to be thousands of miles away and then seemed to be much closer - like an airplane with it's landing lights on - though this light seemed much too bright to be the landing lights of an aircraft that far away). then i thought that it might be a ufo and having read many accounts of people seeing ufos i determined to communicat with the object mentally (i know that sounds weird, but i have read that people have done this and i thought "why not? let's just see what happens!") and i "said" to it - "if you are a ufo, come closer so i can take a really good look at you, but if you are an airplane, then continue doing what you are doing." at that point the object "disappeared". it didn't "fade out" like turning a large dc powered lamp or light off (or like a jetliner turning during an approach pattern). one second it was "there" and in a split second later it was "gone". then i observed what i will describe as "strobes" or quick "flashes of light". they were so tiny and so quick, i questioned whether i had actually seen them or if i was imagining them. there were two strobes\flashes of light. one to the left of the original position of the bright object and one to the right of the original position of the bright object which i initially observed (and the "flashes" might possibly have occured at a slightly different elevation than the original bright stationary object).
trends: There has been one other sighting in Pineville
There were no other sightings in Pineville on or around October 29th 2010
Summary: Star/Planet like object in southern sky approximately 30 degrees above horizon observed for a few minutes before "disappearing".
